009package imagingbook.common.util.bits;
010
011/**
012 * This class implements {@link BitVector} with internal 32-bit {@code int} data.
013 * @author WB
014 */
015public class BitVector32 implements BitVector {
016        
017        private static final int WL = 32;
018        
019        private final int[] data;
020        private final int length;
021        
022        public BitVector32(int length) {
023                this.length = length;
024                int n = (length % WL == 0) ? length / WL : length / WL + 1;     // word count
025                this.data = new int[n];
026        }
027        
028        public BitVector32(byte[] bytes) {
029                this(bytes.length);
030                for (int i = 0; i < bytes.length; i++) {
031                        if (bytes[i] != 0) {
032                                this.set(i);
033                        }
034                }
035        }
036        
037        public BitVector32(boolean[] bools) {
038                this(bools.length);
039                for (int i = 0; i < bools.length; i++) {
040                        this.set(i, bools[i]);
041                }
042        }
043        
044        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
045
046        @Override
047        public int getLength() {
048                return this.length;
049        }
050        
051        @Override
052        public boolean get(int i) {
053                if (i < 0 || i >= length) {
054                        throw new IndexOutOfBoundsException("illegal index " + i);
055                }
056                final int mask = 1 << (i % WL);
057                return (data[i / WL] & mask) != 0;
058        }
059        
060        @Override
061        public void set(int i) {
062                if (i < 0 || i >= length) {
063                        throw new IndexOutOfBoundsException("illegal index " + i);
064                }
065                final int j = i / WL;   // word index
066                final int mask = 1 << (i % WL);
067                data[j] =  data[j] | mask;
068        }
069        
070        @Override
071        public void unset(int i) {
072                if (i < 0 || i >= length) {
073                        throw new IndexOutOfBoundsException("illegal index " + i);
074                }
075                final int j = i / WL;   // word index
076                final int mask = 0x01 << (i % WL);
077                data[j] =  data[j] & ~mask;
078        }
079        
080        @Override
081        public void setAll() {
082                for (int j = 0; j < data.length; j++) {
083                        data[j] = ~0;
084                }
085        }
086
087        @Override
088        public void unsetAll() {
089                for (int j = 0; j < data.length; j++) {
090                        data[j] = 0;
091                }
092        }
093        
094        @Override
095        public String toString() {
096                StringBuilder buf = new StringBuilder();
097                buf.append(BitVector32.class.getSimpleName() + "[");
098                for (int i = 0; i < length; i++) {
099                        buf.append(this.get(i) ? "1" : "0");
100                }
101                buf.append("]");
102                return buf.toString();
103        }
104        
105        //----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
106        
107//      public static void main(String[] args) {
108//              int K = 99;
109//              BitVector32 b = new BitVector32(K);
110//              
111//              System.out.println(b.toString());
112//              b.setAll();
113//              System.out.println(b.toString());
114//              b.unsetAll();
115//              System.out.println(b.toString());
116//              System.out.println();
117//              
118//              for (int i = 0; i < b.length; i++) {
119//                      b.set(i);
120//                      System.out.println(b.toString());
121//                      b.unset(i);
122//              }
123//      }
124
125}
